metadata.Title: CVE-2019-20444 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
HttpObjectDecoder.java in Netty before 4.1.44 allows an HTTP header that lacks a colon, which might be interpreted as a separate header with an incorrect syntax, or might be interpreted as an "invalid fold." It was discovered that Netty has HTTP request smuggling vulnerability. A remote attacker could use it to extract sensitive information.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2019-20444` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnetty-java - 1:4.1.45-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: netty package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:4.1.45-1').
